org.projectfloodlight.openflow.types

Class OFPort

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.projectfloodlight.openflow.types.OFPort
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Comparable<OFPort>, OFValueType<OFPort>, PrimitiveSinkable

    public class OFPort
extends Object
implements OFValueType<OFPort>
    Abstraction of an logical / OpenFlow switch port (ofp_port_no) in OpenFlow. Immutable. Note: Switch port numbers were changed in OpenFlow 1.1 from uint16 to uint32. This class uses a 32 bit representation internally. Port numbers are converted from/to uint16 when constructed / getPortNumberasShort is called. If this port is not representable in OpenFlow 1.0, an IllegalStateException is raised.
    Author:
    Andreas Wundsam <andreas.wundsam@bigswitch.com>

    • Field Detail

      • MAX

        public static final OFPort MAX
        Maximum number of physical and logical switch ports.

      • IN_PORT

        public static final OFPort IN_PORT
        Send the packet out the input port. This reserved port must be explicitly used in order to send back out of the input port.

      • TABLE

        public static final OFPort TABLE
        Submit the packet to the first flow table NB: This destination port can only be used in packet-out messages.

      • NORMAL

        public static final OFPort NORMAL
        Process with normal L2/L3 switching.

      • FLOOD

        public static final OFPort FLOOD
        All physical ports in VLAN, except input port and those blocked or link down

      • ALL

        public static final OFPort ALL
        All physical ports except input port

      • CONTROLLER

        public static final OFPort CONTROLLER
        Send to controller

      • LOCAL

        public static final OFPort LOCAL
        local openflow "port"

      • ANY

        public static final OFPort ANY
        Wildcard port used only for flow mod (delete) and flow stats requests. Selects all flows regardless of output port (including flows with no output port). NOTE: OpenFlow 1.0 calls this 'NONE'

      • ZERO

        public static final OFPort ZERO
        the wildcarded default for OpenFlow 1.0 (value: 0). Elsewhere in OpenFlow we need "ANY" as the default

      • NO_MASK

        public static final OFPort NO_MASK

      • FULL_MASK

        public static final OFPort FULL_MASK

    • Method Detail

      • ofInt

        public static OFPort ofInt(int portNumber)
        get an OFPort object corresponding to a raw 32-bit integer port number. NOTE: The port object may either be newly allocated or cached. Do not rely on either behavior.
        Parameters:
        portNumber - the integer port number
        Returns:
        a corresponding OFPort

      • of

        public static OFPort of(int portNumber)
        convenience function: delegates to ofInt
        Parameters:
        portNumber - the integer port number
        Returns:
        a corresponding OFPort

      • ofShort

        public static OFPort ofShort(short portNumber)
        get an OFPort object corresponding to a raw signed 16-bit integer port number (OF1.0). Note that the port returned will have the corresponding 32-bit integer value allocated as its port number. NOTE: The port object may either be newly allocated or cached. Do not rely on either behavior.
        Parameters:
        portNumber - the short port number
        Returns:
        a corresponding OFPort

      • getPortNumber

        public int getPortNumber()
        return the port number as a int32
        Returns:
        the port number as an integer

      • getShortPortNumber

        public short getShortPortNumber()
        return the port number as int16. Special ports as defined by the OpenFlow spec will be converted to their OpenFlow 1.0 equivalent. port numbers >= FF00 will cause a IllegalArgumentException to be thrown
        Returns:
        the port number as a short
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if a regular port number exceeds the maximum value in OF1.0
